gw.datatype

Class IDataType

  • gw.datatype.IDataType

  • public class IDataType
    A datatype represents additional constraints on a scalar type. For example, a datatype for {@link String} might require the String to consist of exactly 7 digits.

    In addition to constraints on the data, a datatype has a persistence and a presentation component.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      String Name
      Gets the name of this datatype.
      Map<String,String> Parameters
      Gets the parameters used to instantiate this datatype, as a read-only map of names to values.
      IType ValueType
      Gets the value type associated with this datatype.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IConstrainedDataType asConstrainedDataType()
      Provides access to the constraints aspects of this datatype.
      IPersistentDataType asPersistentDataType()
      Provides access to the persistence aspects of this datatype.
      IPresentableDataType asPresentableDataType()
      Provides access to the presentation aspects of this datatype.
      Object parseValue(IPropertyInfo property, String strValue)
      Parses the string form of a value into an object of the datatype's value type.
